alert.note: Alert for Madison; Oneida; Onondaga (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 06 at 12:36AM EDT until April 06 at 6:49PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central New York, including the following counties, Madison, Oneida and Onondaga. * WHEN...Until 230 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1236 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is possible in poor drainage areas. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of around a half inch are possible. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Utica, Rome, Oneida, Hamilton, New Hartford, Sullivan, Lenox, Verona, Westmoreland, Chittenango, Canastota, Floyd, New York Mills, Sherrill, Cazenovia, Yorkville, Morrisville, Stockbridge, Augusta and Nelson. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
